metadata.Title: CVE-2015-1267 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Blink, as used in Google Chrome before 43.0.2357.130, does not properly restrict the creation context during creation of a DOM wrapper, which allows remote attackers to bypass the Same Origin Policy via crafted JavaScript code that uses a Blink public API, related to WebArrayBufferConverter.cpp, WebBlob.cpp, WebDOMError.cpp, and WebDOMFileSystem.cpp.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-1267` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 43.0.2357.130-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1092
chromium-browser-l10n - 43.0.2357.130-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1092
chromium-chromedriver - 43.0.2357.130-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1092
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 43.0.2357.130-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1092
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 43.0.2357.130-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1092
No subscription required

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.7.9-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.7.9-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
liboxideqtquick0 - 1.7.9-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqmlscene - 1.7.9-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-chromedriver - 1.7.9-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-codecs - 1.7.9-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-codecs-extra - 1.7.9-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '43.0.2357.130-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1092').
oxide-qt package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.7.9-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
